results.title: Wildcats and Pipedreams
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Film & Television, John Richardson and David Greig
results.brief_description: Wildcats and Pipedreams follows the crew of an oil drilling rig in the Timor Sea. It gives a fascinating insight into the lives of people living and working in a remote and difficult environment.

results.title: All quiet on the Western Front
results.creator_credit: Delbert Mann, Norman Rosemont and Marble Arch Productions
results.brief_description: Made for television, this adaptation of Erich Maria Remarque’s passionate anti-war novel is a remake of the 1930’s film classic about young German soldiers in the Great war of 1914-18, and of the veteran who teaches them to grow up fast in the trenches. Stars Richard Thomas, Ernest Borgnine, Patricia Neal, Ian Holm and Donald Pleasence.

results.title: Making of a legend: Gone with the wind
results.creator_credit: David Hinton, L. Jeffrey Selznick, Selznick Properties and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: A feature length documentary which takes a behind-the-scenes look at the making of the 1939 feature film “Gone With the Wind”. Utilises some rare film footage including several screen tests for the part of Scarlett O’Hara, and home movies featuring Vivien Leigh. A fascinating inside view of one of the great accomplishments in motion picture history. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Glass menagerie
results.creator_credit: Paul Newman, Burtt Harris and Columbia
results.brief_description: A shy girl seeks escape from reality of life in the St. Louis of the Great Depression and from her mother’s fantasies of constantly reliving the glory of her youth. The fragile balance of the family is changed when her brother arranges for a “gentleman caller” to pay a visit. Based on the play by Tennesse Williams. Stars Joanne Woodward, John Malkovich and Karen Allen.

results.title: King Lear
results.creator_credit: Peter Brook, Michael Birkeit, Columbia, Royal Shakespeare Company and Martin Ransohoff Productions
results.brief_description: This Shakespearian tragedy tells the tale of woe when an old king decides to divide his kingdom amongst his daughters. Directed by Peter Brook and starring Paul Scofield and Irene Worth.

results.title: Cornflakes for tea
results.creator_credit: John Colquhoun, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatization of how a family living in high-rise inner city flats manage to cope with caring for each other when first their mother and then their father abandon them. Provides many points which could act as stimulus for discussion including perspectives on family relationships, contrasts on single parent and conventional nuclear families, welfare workers and their role, supportive community members, and the warm relationship of the central characters.

results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: The Chosen
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Ely Landau, Edie Landau and Chosen Film Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Chaim Potok which explores the friendship that develops between two adolescent Jewish boys living in New York in the 1940s. The boys are from vastly different Jewish backgrounds, one being an Hasidic Jew and the other a Zionist. Features Rod Steiger, Maximilian Schell as the boys fathers together with Robby Benson and Barry Miller.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.

results.title: Wherever she goes
results.creator_credit: Michael S. Gordon and Faun Films
results.brief_description: A film biography of Eileen Joyce, the celebrated Australian pianist concentrating on her childhood in the Tasmanian bush and the Kalgoorlie goldfields. Opening and closing scenes show the pianist herself performing at a concert. Made in Australia by the British Production House Ealing Studios.
